message.content:
cs.LO, cs.DS, cs.PL, cs.FL, cs.CC

The paper deals with the problem of context unification, which is a subvariant of second-order unification. This suggests that the paper may belong to the Logic (cs.LO) sub-category. Additionally, the paper mentions that context unification is a generalization of word equations, which are a topic in the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category. The paper also discusses the recompression technique, which is a topic in the Programming Languages (cs.PL) sub-category. Furthermore, the paper mentions that context unification is a unique problem between second-order unification and word equations, which suggests that it may also be relevant to the Formal Languages and Automata Theory (cs.FL) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the complexity of context unification, which is a topic in the Computational Complexity (cs.CC) sub-category.
